Calling Text.setSize (x,y) with either parameter = 0 causes a null pointer exception inside sendEvent because the Text control's display has been set to null.

The control's display is set to null during the call to OS.gtk_widget_hide (topHandle) in Control.setBounds().  Immediately after, the sendEvent method is invoked, which dereferences the display.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:1087)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:1079)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.setBounds(Control.java:665)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.setSize(Control.java:819)
